title: Leicester 'on hunt for Ben Chilwell's replacement' as Chelsea and Manchester City prepare £50m bids
text:
Leicester City are preparing to replace left-back Ben Chilwell with Manchester City and Chelsea preparing £50 million bids for the defender.

Brendan Rodgers wants to keep the England international at the club but the Foxes are already scouting for a replacement - with Pep Guardiola and Frank Lampard expressing an interest in the 22-year-old, according to the Sun.

Manchester City have previously tried to pursue Chilwell last summer but ultimately opted to stick with Oleksandr Zinchenko and Benjamin Mendy as their left-back options.

The Europa League champions are also in need of a long-term appointment in the left-back position with Marcos Alonso considering his future at the club.

Chilwell has played six matches in the Premier League this season for Leicester City

The left-back was linked with a move to Man City in the summer but stayed with the Foxes

Lampard is eyeing up Chilwell as an option once Chelsea's transfer ban is lifted next summer.

Leicester are reportedly interested in young Bolton Wanderers attacker Ronan Darcy as a potential replacement.

The 18-year-old got his first taste of senior football earlier this season, when Bolton had to field their youth side but Darcy has not featured in recent weeks.
description: Leicester City are eyeing up Bolton youngster as possible replacement for left-back Ben Chilwell. Manchester City and Chelsea are reportedly preparing £50m bids for the defender.
